channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The entirety of Queen’s road is dangerous for pedestrians, 21st August
item.description:
All you need to do is send someone out to walk from the Lansdown to the station on either side of the road and it’s unbelievably clear how dangerous the pavements are. I frequently see people trip on the road, have seen an elderly woman fall and have to be helped, have tripped myself including twice this morning (on different sides of the road!), and last year in fact fractured my elbow as well as losing two fingernails due to falling, caused the the irregularities in the pavement on the way from the station to Tivoli. I don’t know why you’ve not attempted to fix these issues for the 3 years I’ve lived here, but it’s time a project was undertaken to make it safe. I would never want to see the trees cut down and understand the pavement will not be perfectly level, but it must become less of a hazard to those of us using it. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 43, Queen's Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Several large potholes, 21st August
item.description:
There are several large potholes and damage to the road surface on the westbound stretch of Lobleys Drive approaching the bridge over the M5. These have been getting worse over a period of several months and likely to cause damage to suspension and tyres.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned lorry and large trailer, 20th August
item.description:
In the layby are 2 vehicles that haven't moved for the last 4 months but instead I belive have been abandoned, both vehicles are white but one is a lorry and one is a lorry trailer. Please can these be looked into as they look as if they they will be vandalised or arsoned soon. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Andoversford, Cotswold

item.title: Very large pothole on pavement, 20th August
item.description:
The pothole is on the pavement exactly in front of house 115 Hesters Way Road GL51 0RJ. It has been there for several months and it keeps getting wider, especially when it has been raining.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 113, Hesters Way Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: Long grass obstructs view of oncoming traffic., 20th August
item.description:
Turning right off Cirencester Road into Ermin Way, tall grass on central reservation obstructing view of oncoming traffic. This is accentuated by a hump in the road and the bend. There is a likelihood of a head on collision!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The rainwater gully is blocked, causing significant pooling on road, 20th August
item.description:
There are three gullies outside Brook House, Court Road, GL3 4QT. This is the lowest point in the road. They are blocked. Within 5 minutes of heavy rain this morning there was significant flooding across the road, causing vehicles to drive on wrong side of road to avoid. Sadly witnessed two pedestrians get very splashed from a vehicle driving past.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Road, Brockworth, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot holes at the entrance to Meadow way & The Holt Bishops Cleeve, 20th August
item.description:
This road repair has now been necessary for at least 2 Years, whilst other roads around the village are repaired this road remains a disgrace on a link road into a quality housing area ( The Holt) I have sent photos in the past but no response was received.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Tewkesbury

item.title: All street lights out on Kingsmead road, 19th August
item.description:
From village road to princess Elizabeth way all the street lights are out along Kingsmead road. This was reported before but it's been over 2 weeks that they have been out and now the nights are drawing in it's getting darker earlier. I would like something done asap as nothing is getting done.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Kingsmead Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
